headline.main: Passive Smoke Harms Heart, Researcher Says

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Nonsmokers who live with smokers have a 20 percent to 30 percent higher risk of dying from heart disease than do other nonsmokers, a researcher said yesterday.
docs.snippet: LEAD: Nonsmokers who live with smokers have a 20 percent to 30 percent higher risk of dying from heart disease than do other nonsmokers, a researcher said yesterday.

headline.main: Health Dept. Softens Stance on Cigarette Exports

byline.original: By PHILIP J. HILTS, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: After months of vigorous campaigning against the dangers of smoking, the Government's health agency today backed away from its past criticism of efforts to open new markets for American cigarettes around the world.
docs.snippet: LEAD: After months of vigorous campaigning against the dangers of smoking, the Government's health agency today backed away from its past criticism of efforts to open new markets for American cigarettes around the world.
